intro: Premna cavaleriei, commonly known as the Chinese nettle or Chinese premna, is a flowering plant native to southern China. It is a deciduous shrub that typically grows to a height of about 1 to 2 meters. The plant features opposite, ovate leaves with serrated edges and produces small, greenish-white flowers in clusters. It belongs to the family Verbenaceae and is characterized by its hairy stems and glandular leaves. Premna cavaleriei is often found in moist, shaded environments such as forests and along stream banks.
